page.title: 09MILKING LANE FARM
page.content:
FARMING IN BIGGIN HILL
Milking Lane is a beef fatening and cereal farm covering 363 acres, 250 of which are rented from the Biggin Hill airport authority. They keep 200 cattle mainly Charolais, Blond Aquitaines and Herefords. They are fed on silage and cereal in the winter and sold off at regular intervals. they grow wheat and oats for sale in the open market and barley for fodder. A typical year for the farmer starting in September would be to plough and set the winter cereals; buy the cattle in October and feed and look after them in the winter months. In february the organic and inorganic fertilizers are spread on the cereals and the grass. In May the grass is cut to make silage. The cereals are harvested from late July to August.
